question: Question_B_03_(d)
statement:
A random walk problem with two states has a transition matrix

\[P = \left[\begin{array}{cc} 1/3 & 1/4 \\ 2/3 & 3/4\end{array}\right]\]

d) After many time steps what state is the walker more likely to be?
Justify briefly.
sols:
Using our answer from c), we can study the limit where $n$ goes to
infinity. In this case the probability vector approaches

\[\hat{\mathbf{v}} = \lim_{n \rightarrow \infty}P^{n}\mathbf{v} = \left[\begin{array}{c}3/11 \\ 8/11\end{array}\right].\]

Hence, it is more likely, that the walker will be be in state 2 after a
large number of steps, since the 2nd entry in the vector is larger than
the first entry.
hints:
In your result from c) let the number of step sizes \emph{n} go to
infinity.
